author: jimmygchen
content: hi, I have newbie question - what does the tx `to` address mean in the context of a blob transaction?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: A blob transaction can trigger evm execution, so it's exactly the same as the to field for every other transaction type

author: jimmygchen
content: Thanks Marius. In the case where it doesn't trigger an evm execution, does the value simply get ignored?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: No, it will send the 'value' to this address, if there's no value attached, nothing happens, just like a normal zero send

author: timbeiko
content:
**4844 Implementers' Call in ~1h (14:30 UTC)**
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/650
Zoom: https://ethereumfoundation.zoom.us/j/88332629239?pwd=YmNpVVpaVy93RXhOTS9DYmNtWGtLdz09
Notes from prev calls: https://docs.google.com/document/d/15EatedrJanNxBZGPVASvwq9xgbTs5UxjsDfjpM6ppSY/edit#

Not livestreamed, but will be recorded and uploaded to YT later today.

author: inphi
content:
I'm not going to be able to attend the community call.
Missed a flight and got rebooked on another for 10:30 Eastern ðŸ˜  
My current status: Implementing the Capella rebase (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3052) for prysm. Capella isn't fully implemented in prysm and there's some missing functionality needed for the rebase. So I'm implementing them myself, which is taking a bit of time. I'll be done by EOD tomorrow.
Next step for me is to merge the changes to Terence's 4844 branch.
A note: Very nice to see some 4844 stuff (https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/pull/11596) upstreamed to prysm.

author: jessepollak
content:
Hi all - thanks for attending the implementers call today. 

**Action items**

- <@552133098075193354> Follow up on whitelisting the external links in the EIP4844 specification
- @adietrichs Merge the PR that returns the modulus from the precompile
- @adietrichs Add spec update 4844 for specifying that blobs must only be announced
- <@552133098075193354>  Discuss engine API PR with Mikhail / Matt to see if they have any objections
- <@862973562243252234> Confirm with Romana that crypto interfaces changes can be implemented in c-kzg
- <@203220829473996800> Merge the consensus spec PR related to fee market change
- <@607055410104500244> Connect Poan to Dankrad/Romana to work on Rust bindings for c-kzg

Full notes here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/15EatedrJanNxBZGPVASvwq9xgbTs5UxjsDfjpM6ppSY/edit#. Please feel free to ask any questions here!

author: inphi
content:
Caught up on the recording. Thanks to everyone that participated.

Re Capella on 4844: We should work towards the Capella rebase PR for devnet-3 rather than wait for Danny's changes to the capella beacon state. At least, assuming we don't the the beacon state updates aren't decided on Thursday's consensus call. This is so devnet-3 implementooors have a spec they can work towards today. (Or could we disable 4844 pyspec tests in the PR and merge it in, so Ryan's PR can be merged later without CI? <@415109946682769408>)
From the pov of a devnet-3 implementooor, Danny's proposed changes to the beacon state are minimal because we'll be stubbing out all withdrawals functionality. Even if we later decide to use the updated beacon state for devnet-3, it shouldn't be difficult for implementooors to make changes.
The whole reason why we want devnet-3 to include Capella is so clients can easily implement 4844 on top of the current work on capella.

author: inphi
content: Hey Inphi2946 I wonder if you got a

author: terence0083
content:
The issue is current capella spec is highly unstable with the following two prs in flux:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3068
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3042

Beacon state and block objects are looking different in various proposals which will lead to incorrect HTR even if we stub all the fields to emptyies or 0s. I think this thursday, we should have some clarify on which direction to go

author: inphi
content: The instability is manageable I think. We just need to agree on which proposal we're going with for devnet-3 as early as possible. Let's see how the Thursday consensus call goes.

author: terence0083
content:
It's manageable, and it's just time spent cost. We don't want to spend half a day implementing a withdrawal queue to the beacon state and then rip it all out tomorrow ðŸ™‚
I'll be happy to bite the bullet if there's no strong consensus on Thursday.

author: inphi
content: For the devnet, we don't need a full-blown withdrawal logic. But only need to add the withdrawal_queue (and any other proposed fields) to the beacon state.

author: terence0083
content: Yeah but the withdrawal queue might be gone very very soon
